topProducts.name: Rice
topProducts.description: Frequently served as a side, with mixed reviews; some found it 'old and reheated' with a 'slimy texture,' while others noted it as a common accompaniment to meals.
quotes: I ordered the Feast combo kebab (one beef kebab, one chicken kebab, salad, rice, and a Coke)
All I have was rice, 2 kebabs, and veggies

topProducts.name: Gyros
topProducts.description: A popular choice, including 'gyro wrap' and 'gyro pita,' described as 'the BOMB!!!' and 'delicious,' though one review mentioned an 'excessive' price.
quotes: Iâ€™m trying to eat less gluten and love gyros and meddteranian food

topProducts.name: Chicken Kebab
topProducts.description: A common entree item, often part of combo meals. Described as 'fine' to 'delicious tenderloin and chicken kebab.'
quotes: I ordered the Feast combo kebab (one beef kebab, one chicken kebab, salad, rice, and a Coke)

topProducts.name: Chicken Shawarma
topProducts.description: A favorite, especially 'on a pita,' praised as 'comfort to me' and 'the BOMB!!!'
quotes: Chicken shawarma pita and gyro pita were the BOMB
I've only done takeout of the family chicken shawarma meal and hummus
Best chicken Shawarma and tzatziki sauce I've ever had

topProducts.name: Coffee
topProducts.description: Includes various types such as 'Turkish coffee' and general 'coffee,' consistently lauded as 'the best' and 'amazing.'
quotes: The best coffee and babaghanoush - for real, delicious
Today I ordered a gyro wrap (no rice, no fries, etc) and a coffee and paid over $15 - before the tip
The Turkish coffee is amazing â˜•

topProducts.name: Babaghanoush
topProducts.description: A highly-rated appetizer or side, described as 'delicious' and 'for real, delicious.'
quotes: The best coffee and babaghanoush - for real, delicious

topProducts.name: Salad
topProducts.description: Offered as a side or part of larger meals, noted for being 'fresh and flavorful.'
quotes: I ordered the Feast combo kebab (one beef kebab, one chicken kebab, salad, rice, and a Coke)
We just enjoyed a kebab dinner with chicken, rice, babaganoush, hummus, flatbread, and salad
Love that you guys offered side salad and rice as options (keep in mind this is an extra charge)

topProducts.name: Baklava
topProducts.description: A dessert that, while appreciated, was sometimes noted for presentation issues like being 'fallen apart' or 'in crumbles.'
quotes: The food was good and generous in amount other than the baklava which had fallen apart and was less than 1
The place was busy but the owner remembered our allergy & even gave us some baklava

highlightedReviews.author: Yen Cheng (Rachael)
highlightedReviews.text:
Hubby and I was really craving Mediterranean/greek food- I went out of the way to drive to pick up our order. Road construction and parking was questionable, but I was able to find a safe spot to park during the night where I didnâ€™t have to walk too far after scoping the area around the buildings aside from this restaurant for the first time.

Chicken shawarma pita and gyro pita were the BOMB!!! Love that you guys offered side salad and rice as options (keep in mind this is an extra charge)! Hubby and I really went big backing on this place and that was only our first time ordering too and we wanted to try a variety!

I am so excited to order from Shish again in the next couple of months when we have our cravings to try the numerous other delicious things on the menu!  Portions were unexpectedly generous that we actually have leftover food saved for the next day (for the price I paid I feel that itâ€™s wonderful and fair)! When I came inside to pick up our order around 8pm it dining room was booming with people at the booths! When you come to this place whether it be for lunch or for dinner (especially when the whole road in front of the restaurant is closed off for construction) and see that the place is busy at peak meal times, you KNOW itâ€™s worth the walk to get in and order or to sit down and grab a bite to eat!

10000/10 would make a take out order again or better yet weâ€™ll try and come back to have a sit-in dining experience!

highlightedReviews.author: Andrew Hamilton
highlightedReviews.text: We have been enjoying shish for many years. It never disappoints, and there are so many options. Every time I have their dishes, I think "why haven't I had this sooner?". That's a true sign of how great shish is. We just enjoyed a kebab dinner with chicken, rice, babaganoush, hummus, flatbread, and salad. We need to do this more often.

highlightedReviews.author: Chloe Kirk
highlightedReviews.text:
We catered our grooms dinner from here and WOW!! Blown away!! We ordered more than enough food but people loved it so much by the end of the night it was gone because people came back for seconds thirds and fourths. Also a big plug for getting it the night before your wedding because itâ€™s filling while still being healthy and not too heavy so it was perfect for the pre-wedding nerves :) tons of compliments that it was the best Mediterranean food people had had!

Picture doesnâ€™t show the spanakopita (a MUST try), pita bread (so good you can eat it plain) and salad!

highlightedReviews.author: Alyssa Schulke
highlightedReviews.text:
I could eat their hummus every frickin' day.

Big portion sizes, a lot of options for vegetarians and vegans. Food is consistently good.  They have more selections on the menu than you might expect (burgers, curry, breakfast, kids menus).

I just order the maza mix with extra pita and go to town.

highlightedReviews.author: T A
highlightedReviews.text: Love this restaurant! The shish burger is my go to option. Itâ€™s good to know the owner Leo is a Palestinian from Jerusalem. Honestly I wouldnâ€™t eat here if it was an Israeli masquerading as a middle-eastern owner. Appreciate their administrative staff for being honest about that when I called to ask.

highlightedReviews.author: Kallee Graham
highlightedReviews.text: Iâ€™ve been coming here for years, my friend got us take out once and ever since Iâ€™ve been obsessed and continue to come back for the best falafel wraps/bowls/pitas. The carrot cake is also fantastic. Any time Iâ€™ve brought someone here who has or has not had Mediterranean food they always enjoy it! ðŸ˜Š itâ€™s a consistent 10/10 in my book

highlightedReviews.author: Blythe Norenberg
highlightedReviews.text: Shish was delicious!  I loved their crispy seasoned fries to go with the Leo Burger. ðŸ˜‹. The chicken shawarma atop the hummus really hit the spot, and the veggies were sweet and crisp! We wish our city had a Shish!

highlightedReviews.author: Sarah West
highlightedReviews.text:
I have been eating here for many years, since it opened. It had a period where the owner seemed to be struggling to hire and maintain good employees. My sense now is that things have stabilized and that the quality has returned to excellent.

Some things to keep in mind is that this is an order at the counter restaurant, a bit on the casual end of things. Your food may not arrive at your table at the same time as your companionâ€”this is not a failure, but instead part of the design of the place. See this as somewhere relaxed where you can get flavorful, delicious food. Also, they can get slammed at lunchtime. If you need to get in and out quickly, it may be better for you to order takeout.

highlightedReviews.author: Fatima Miranda
highlightedReviews.text: I have been to this place many times and recommend the following menu items, which are some of my favorites. Gyro Pita, falafel bowl, hish breakfast, spinach omelet and the chicken sandwich.

highlightedReviews.author: Amber Cathey Lahm
highlightedReviews.text:
Short review: Authentic. Fresh. Served with love.

Long review: Wow. What an AMAZING spot for breakfast. I came pregnant, not wanting any raw egg or feta cheese. The owner talked me through the menu and cheerfully exclaimed he would fix any dish the way I needed it. We ended up getting two breakfast dishes to share family style. The owner was careful to hard scramble the eggs and put all the fresh feta on the side. It was a FEAST! He even gave us some Arabic coffee and read our mug for us. It was evident that love played a big role in everything he did that morning, and truly has been the highlight to my day!

I highly recommend the Arabic tea and coffee.
